title: Amazon KDP Keyword Research Strategy & Tools to Get You Books Found & Lower Your ACOS!

tactics.name: Keyword Research with Tools
tactics.description: Use free plugins like AMZ Suggestion Expansion and Seller Sprite to identify high-value keywords and optimize book titles/subtitles for low ACOS.
steps: Copy Amazon search terms using AMZ Suggestion Expansion
Analyze BSR and ACOS data with free plugins
Select top search terms for book title and subtitle
Deep dive into competitor books using Reviceise Async
caveats: Requires manual campaigns for established niches
source_quotes: "I use Seller Sprite for keyword research..."

tactics.name: bsr_keyword_research
tactics.description: Use free trial to gather seasonal keywords for niche products
steps: Check BSR and review counts of low BSR books
Use Publisher Rocket's 3-day free trial for keyword research
Compile keywords from search results into a notepad
caveats: Free trial limits keyword depth for seasonal products
source_quotes: the free version is limited to 30 days search result

tactics.name: keyword stuffing with single words
tactics.description: Use single words or non-sensical keyword combinations in title/subtitle/description to trigger Amazon's search algorithm
steps: Fill in seven keywords regardless of coherence
source_quotes: they don't have to make sense. They don't have to read. They can just be single words

heuristics.name: Low ACOS Prioritization
heuristics.condition: If ACOS is below 2.5 and BSR under 50,000, prioritize optimization

heuristics.name: keyword_relevance_filter
heuristics.condition: If keyword doesn't describe book content, avoid it
source_quotes: you don't want to use keyword that does not describe your book at all

heuristics.name: boost low review titles
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting
source_quotes: I only use the free version and that's been working out really good for me

claims.statement: Automatic ads can achieve low ACOS with optimized keywords
source_quotes: "My ad campaign is just lottery ads..."

claims.statement: Amazon may flag or block books with irrelevant keywords
source_quotes: Amazon can pick it up and it can flag your book or block your book in the future

claims.statement: Amazon combines keywords from title, subtitle, description, and keywords field to match search terms
source_quotes: as long as your words are there they can figure out how to puzzle them together

niche_patterns.example: animal coloring books + easy + low ACOS
niche_patterns.description: Combine specific niches with search terms to target low-cost keywords
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages high-search-volume terms with low competition

niche_patterns.example: adult coloring book + stress relief + large print
niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience needs with keyword optimization
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines product identity with problem-solving and format constraints
source_quotes: we don't want to use keyword that does not describe your book at all
